entity1.name: Genetic engineering
entity1.description: A scientific discipline that involves the direct manipulation of an organism's genes using biotechnology.

entity2.name: medicine
entity2.description: The science and practice of diagnosing, treating, and preventing disease.

entity3.name: agriculture
entity3.description: The practice of cultivating the land or raising stock to produce food, fiber, and other products.

entity4.name: genetic engineering
entity4.description: A branch of biotechnology that involves the direct manipulation of an organism's genes using biotechnology.

entity5.name: genes
entity5.description: Segments of DNA that code for specific proteins and are responsible for hereditary traits.

entity6.name: designer babies
entity6.description: Infants whose genetic makeup has been artificially selected or altered to ensure the presence or absence of particular genes and their corresponding traits.

entity7.name: genetically modified crops
entity7.description: Plants that have had specific changes introduced into their DNA using genetic engineering techniques, often to enhance desired traits such as resistance to pests or tolerance to environmental conditions.

entity8.name: genetically engineered animals
entity8.description: Animals that have had their DNA modified using genetic engineering techniques, often for research, agricultural, or medical purposes.

entity9.name: genetic disorders
entity9.description: Diseases or conditions caused by abnormalities in the genome of an organism.

entity10.name: food production
entity10.description: The process of growing and harvesting crops and raising livestock for human consumption.

entity11.name: playing god
entity11.description: A term used to describe the act of humans taking on a role that is traditionally ascribed to a deity, particularly in contexts involving significant control over life and death or fundamental aspects of existence.

entity12.name: genetic engineering
entity12.description: A scientific discipline focused on the direct manipulation of an organism's genes using biotechnology to alter genetic material in a way that does not occur naturally.

entity13.name: genetically modified organisms (GMOs)
entity13.description: Organisms whose genetic material has been altered using genetic engineering techniques.

entity14.name: human consumption
entity14.description: The act of eating or drinking by humans, often in the context of food safety and nutrition.

entity15.name: environment
entity15.description: The surroundings or conditions in which an organism lives, including both living and non-living components.

entity16.name: genetic testing
entity16.description: A process used to identify changes in chromosomes, genes, or proteins. It can be used for various purposes including diagnosis, treatment, and prediction of diseases.

entity17.name: privacy
entity17.description: The right of an individual to keep their personal matters and relationships secret from others.

entity18.name: consent
entity18.description: An agreement or permission given by a person for something to happen, often in the context of medical procedures or data usage.

entity19.name: discrimination
entity19.description: The unjust or prejudicial treatment of different categories of people, especially on the grounds of race, age, or sex.

entity20.name: genetic traits
entity20.description: Characteristics or qualities that are passed from parents to offspring through their genes.

entity21.name: genetic technologies
entity21.description: Technological advancements in genetics that allow for the manipulation and analysis of genetic material.

entity22.name: gap
entity22.description: A disparity or difference between groups, often referring to economic or social inequalities.

entity23.name: genetic engineering
entity23.description: A set of technologies used to change the genetic makeup of cells, including the transfer of genes within and across species.

entity24.name: genetic code
entity24.description: The sequence of nucleotides in DNA or RNA that specifies the amino acid sequence of proteins, which are essential for life processes.

entity25.name: genetic engineering
entity25.description: A branch of biotechnology that involves the direct manipulation of an organism's genes using biotechnology.

entity26.name: genome
entity26.description: The complete set of genetic material (DNA or RNA) present in a cell or organism.

entity27.name: genetic engineering
entity27.description: A scientific field that involves the direct manipulation of an organism's genes using biotechnology.

entity28.name: science
entity28.description: The systematic and organized body of knowledge about the natural world, including its structure, function, and processes.

entity29.name: human health
entity29.description: The state of being free from illness or injury, encompassing physical, mental, and social well-being.
